meanings.definition: To protect someone or something too much
meanings.sent1: She tends to overprotect her little sister, always making sure she is safe.
meanings.sent2: Parents sometimes overprotect their children out of love and concern.
meanings.sent3: The security guard at the museum was so overprotective, he wouldn't even let visitors touch the exhibits.
meanings.sent4: The mother bird would overprotect her chicks, never letting them wander too far from the nest.
meanings.sent5: The knight vowed to overprotect the kingdom from any harm, standing guard day and night.

meanings.definition: To be excessively cautious or vigilant in protecting someone or something
meanings.sent1: He tends to overprotect his phone, always keeping it in a protective case.
meanings.sent2: Some people overprotect their passwords, changing them frequently to avoid any risks.
meanings.sent3: The bodyguard was so overprotective, he even checked the air quality before allowing the VIP to enter the room.
meanings.sent4: The farmer would overprotect his crops, using scarecrows and fences to keep pests away.
meanings.sent5: The queen's loyal guard would overprotect her, never letting anyone get too close without thorough inspection.
